NH Brussels Grand Place Arenberg Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 215 reviews

Warm greetings from the staff when we arrived the hotel. The room was spacious and got all you need.

At first, there was only one small pillow for 2 of us. However, we found out the hotel offers a 'Choose your pillow' service, which let you choose the type of pillow you want. Nice touch! Our room rate included free-of-charge minibar service and we enjoy the snacks and drinks provided. Breakfast was excellent! They offered a wide range of food & drink and you can start your day with a good breakfast. Hotel location is just perfect! Taking you 5-min to walk from the Centraal Station, it takes the same time to reach the Grand Place. There are restaurant round the corner also. The only thing to improve is the wifi connection. Free access to wifi available at the lobby. But you have to login again every 30 minutes with different login names & password. Each set of login name & password is provided by a paper, which means you will waste 2 papers if you have to stay connected for an hour.

Show more
Chi , Hong Kong
The Hotel Brussels
8.2 Excellent
Based on 19 reviews

Hotel Du Congres
7.8 Very good
Based on 15 reviews

Novotel Brussels Centre Midi Station Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 211 reviews

Easy to locate - long Avenue Fonsny, barely 5 min walk away from the Bruxelles-Midi station. It is also only one station away the Grand Place.

Trains to other cities/towns (Ghent, Brugges) easily available at Bruxelles-Midi. Also easy to obtain a SIM card for your phone there. Hotel is clean, modern, with a great view - if you like seeing trains trundle by, which I do. Internet is very reliable. It also has lockers to store your luggage if you arrive early. Hotel cafe is modest at best though, so I would recommend eating out. There is a supermarket on the way to the hotel. It also has a post office there, so you can send your postcards if you want. Great for business or younger travellers. The area or the hotel itself does not have many child-friendly activities so it is less suitable for young parents with young children. For Muslim travellers, the hotel is right next to a cafe run by Muslim migrants. Food is homefare but very affordable. From the map, the hotel is also very near the Islamic Centre for Brussels, but we did not go there. Hotel staff also very efficient and friendly. Would go back again if I were ever to be in Brussels again.

Show more
Noorul , Singapore
NH Collection Brussels Centre
8 Very good
Based on 80 reviews

Located very close to De Brouckere metro station, making commuting easy. I got the slightly bigger room at a few dollars more and it was definitely worth it.

Room had an additional sofa while toilet was spacious. Fitness center is impressive, as it is operated by HealthCity. Wide range of fitness facilities/weights. Also houses a sauna and steam bath. Breakfast on the 9th floor was also good. Had the snack bar included when I booked my room, so it was totally value for money.

Show more
EDWIN , Singapore
Hilton Brussels Grand Place
8.5 Excellent
Based on 133 reviews

I enjoyed my brief stay at Hilton Grand Place. I was on the train from Brugge and the train stopped at Brussels Central.

From there I started browsing through my map and I started to locate the hotel from Madeleine. Upon alighting the train a stranger may find itself on an exit facing the Hilton, or otherwise the Parc or Madeleine exits. In which case I would recommend that Hilton puts up its directional signs to guide the traveler where the hotel is. As for the hotel, the staff are welcoming and attentive, especially the ones at the Epicentre Restaurant. The food selection was up to the mark. I do recommend this hotel. It certainly adds up to make a great holiday in Brussels.

Show more
Dennis , Philippines
Novotel Brussels Off Grand Place Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 192 reviews

Get off at Centrale Station up the escalators (not top floor of elevator when you buy train tickets back to airport) and look for Galerie Horta.

Go thru empty plaza down wooden escalators and pass Smurf or Toon Museum thru exit and entrance hotel is on the left 50 m. Best way if you have to roll your luggage. The other way pass the left side of Ler Meridien seen from elevator top floor (ticket booth) is cobble stone sidewalk 250 m just behind Ler Meridien. Excellent location just a few mins walk to grand palace and Manneken Pls Great to explore as have both Metro Lines 2 Euro per trip or 6 Euro day pass and train lines. Room was nice size for Europe, breakfast was included but nothing to write about and probably not worth ER Euro. Wifi free but as usual booked room probably gets the least reception from experience with Novotel booked rooms. Only weak pt Bed was like a cot, noisy when you move around. Please invest in better beds and pillows. Families with children be careful of soft core porn on free tv but this is all over Europe at nite. Can hear people rolling their luggage from Train Station thru Cobble walkways from 1st floor Rm 125 Helpful staff. Had an Umbrella I could borrow. Would be nice if they could readily point out places to visit, but could go to tourist info center 300 m on main road. 3 Free Internet Macs in the Lobby. Restaurant row nearby did not impress, probably a tourist trap. Tried both Chez ... Mussels is probably the dish to try.

Show more
MARK , Thailand
easyHotel Brussels City Centre
8.1 Excellent
Based on 133 reviews

there was problem with the faucet and the sink. the staff was v nice (who was a very polite gentleman) helped us in mid night.

also water from the shower leaks from the shower cabinet. fault in design i guess. small room, small desk and small area for placing your own stuff. suggest the hotel to arrange some hooks on the wall which doesn't occupy space but can bring much convenience to the guest. overall it was a nice stay.

Show more
Wing-Sze , Hong Kong
NH Brussels Stéphanie
7.9 Very good
Based on 58 reviews

The Hotel was very well situated for our weekend trip, both leisure and business. The metro was not far away, but it was very easy to walk around the city, if not raining.

I liked the fact that the rooms were very comfortable and clean. A nice touch was choice of pillows, and as I have a tendency to stiff necks, the support pillow was an excellent choice for me. The breakfasts were good, plenty of choice for both continental and full english. The fruit was fresh. An excellent choice for a trip to Brussels and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Show more
Jean , United Kingdom
Sheraton Brussels Airport Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 24 reviews

PULLMAN BRUSSELS CENTRE MIDI
8.8 Excellent
Based on 108 reviews

I took a train from Amsterdam to Brussels, and arrived at Brussels Central Station. To my surprise, the hotel entrance is located less than 150m from where I got off the train, inside the terminal.

Check in was a breeze, and staff was helpful and friendly. The whole hotel looks new and refreshing. The room is definitely of a Pullman-quality. Quiet and sound proof was great. Comfortable bed, fast and free wifi connection in room and lobby; but I only wish the shower pressure was a bit better in the room. Breakfast was acceptable, nothing to complain about. Service to make up room was fast and early. Definitely highly recommended for your stay in Brussels, if you travel by train.

Show more
Loh , Malaysia
Steigenberger Wiltcher's
8.8 Excellent
Based on 20 reviews

NH Collection Brussels Grand Sablon
8.2 Excellent
Based on 67 reviews

Very friendly staff, however the images posted on Agoda for the standard rooms are not the ones offered by the hotel upon check-in, I had to insist and finally they gave me the rooms as per the agoda images for the standard room, which in the hotel's view they are strictly superior or deluxe and initially they wanted me to pay an extra 20 euro a night but upon my insistence the Guest Relations Manager agreed to move me to the better rooms without any extra surcharge.

The rooms the hotel wanted to offer me initially were old and dated, not the ones advertised or shown in the agoda website. Be warned, otherwise the hotel is fantastic in every sense, room service quite inexpensive too, which is a plus in Brusssels.

Show more
JC , Australia
9HOTEL CENTRAL
8.9 Excellent
Based on 100 reviews

We had a pretty good stay. Hotel was very modern and clean. Staff was friendly enough but didn't seem to want to go the extra mile.

Also, not a major point, but we stayed here for one night of our honeymoon and it was the only hotel that didn't acknowledge our honeymoon (which was written in the "additional notes" section of our reservation). Other hotels left a card in our room, decorated the room with rose petals, gave us champagne, or upgraded us to a bigger suite room free of charge. In other words, other hotels at least took a few minutes to congratulate us in some way, which was a really nice touch. This hotel seems to give the bare minimum only. Another example of this is when we asked for recommendations or help with directions - bare minimum only.

Show more
Jean , United States
Warwick Brussels - Grand Place
8.3 Excellent
Based on 118 reviews

We were disappointed upon check in that the front desk made a mistake by providing us one room instead of two as the print out we had on Agoda reservation.

It was later found out that the registration made a mistake on our name but there was no apologise for the mistake and the wait, instead the front desk was bring very protective and agitative which made us very uncomfortable. When enquired more of the payment condition and internet access, they were very impatience and attitude was provocative and challenging. Furthermore we were disappointed that during our stay the sauna was not working, in this cold and wet winter. The porter and concierge were very attentive and helpful though. The hotel is well located a bit off the centre which is just off the crowd and noise, accessible to major attraction on foot and easy access to outskirt with the central train station near it.

Show more
Kiat , Malaysia
Ibis Brussels Off Grand Place Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 161 reviews

Book this room for my parents and me, and we were pleased overall. Although parking was charged separately and rather expensive at 14.

90 Euros per night, the carpark was located near to the hotel, and was regulated with security cameras for a peace of mind. Room was big and clean, and beds were comfy. I enjoyed my single bed, which was miles better than the bunk bed that requires you to climb in some european hotels when you have 3 people. Location was just 2 minutes walk from the Grand Place, which is the main attraction in Brussels. Good choices of food and shopping for belgian chocolates as well. On the other hand, I wouldn't recommend going out alone late at night, as beggars in the area seem much daring and may walk right up to you asking for money. Will definitely consider returning to this hotel in the future.

Show more
YanYe , Singapore
Hotel Metropole
8.1 Excellent
Based on 93 reviews

The Hotel Metropole is conveniently located five to six blocks from the Grand Place. The property is adjacent to a subway station and fifteen to twenty minutes' walk from Brussles Central train station.

This hotel has been operating since 1885. Décor is absolutely charming - particularly in public areas. Standard rooms have adequate size and furnishings. Staff are very frindly and helpful. At the front desk, professional employees provide service in French, Dutch, English, Spanish and other languages. Dining is a very pleasant experience in any of the various restaurants. You may wish to take into account, however, that some of the prices can be far from modest.

Show more
Günther , Mexico
Saint-Nicolas Hotel Brussels
7.6 Very good
Based on 141 reviews

The location was good but take note that taxis cannot get to the front of the hotel because the road is blocked.

You'll have to walk a fair bit to get to the taxi stand, not all that far perhaps but it's veeery far for people with a lot of luggage. And because of all the shopping we had done in our travels, we had A LOT. While I understand that this is something they cannot help, I think it best to forewarn everyone that you CANNOT expect to get any assistance from the staff on this front. This is by far the most dissatisfied I have ever been with a hotel in my travels. I have stayed in all sorts of places all over the world BUT the manner in which I was treated by the staff had me bristling. They were arrogant and condescending and borderline rude. Specially the asian woman at the desk the morning that we left. She certainly left a sour taste in my mouth and dealing with her made my Belgium stop a lot less pleasant.

Show more
Stephanie , Philippines
Thon Hotel EU
8.5 Excellent
Based on 86 reviews

The hotel provided great experience while visiting Brussels, Belgium. It was very clean and modern. The room had everything we needed.

Great access to the airport (bus). However, the room we reserved didn't come with free wifi. Apparently, depending on how you reserved the room it will either come with or not come with free wifi. I think hotels these days should provide free wifi for all customers. However, the lobby did have 4 computers for guests to use so it was okay. Also, it is about a 20 min walk to the Grand Plaza (the main attraction in Brussels). It doesn't seem that far but if you do it everyday in the morning and night it does feel a tad far after walking around the whole day. However, great experience and friendly staff to guide you for traveling around Brussels and even gave us tips on how to visit Gent and Brugges.

Show more
Sean , United States
MEININGER Hotel Brussel City Center
8.2 Excellent
Based on 162 reviews

If you are travelling alone this is a great place to met people as it is kind of a combination of a modern hostel and a hotel, so backpackers rent a dorm and if you are traveling on business you can just book a whole room at a very good price, the place is new and very nice looking, and I as I am still young and travelling on business on my own, I really like to met new people, so this is the place, I end up hanging our with a nice crew of 3 guys from AU, US and Canada so nice to hear all their travelling experiences backpacking etc.

I value this much more than overrated business hotels without any character and moody old "working" business type people.

Show more
Efren , United Kingdom
Hotel Midi-Zuid
7.2 Very good
Based on 61 reviews

Awful hotel in one of the most dangerous parts of Brussels. We got stuck in the lift numerous times with no response from the staff.

Rooms smelt of smoke and badly in need of a repair. The nightclub next door was very loud and made it very difficult to sleep. The drilling in the wall at 5:30am didn't help either. This hotel is half a star at best an if you value your safety avoid at all costs. The taxi driver's comments were, "this is a very bad part of town I never usually drive in here when I drop you off promise me you will not leave the hotel until te morning"

Show more
Diarmaid , Ireland
Sandton Brussels Centre Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 69 reviews

sandton brussels centre is located very close to the central train station. when we arrived we asked for an upgrade and got a free upgrade to a large suite on the top floor.

the room we had was huge and there was a separate lounge as well. the tv though, was in the lounge area so we couldn't watch tv from the bed. the bed and pillow were very comfortable and the bathroom was very big and modern. free wifi was included. there was alot of furniture in the room as well. if you are a light sleeper you may not want to stay here as there is a church around the corner and we could hear loud ringing sounds in the morning. we walked to all the attractions around brussels and also went on a day trip to bruges as well. it is not as near to the tourist area but we wanted to stay somewhere that would be easier for us to get to bruges. it is also very convenient to take public transport as it is near the central station.

Show more
Franca , Australia
NH Brussels Airport Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 41 reviews

A smart boutique style hotel in the heart of the business district close to the airport. Clean and well equipped rooms, superb shower and bathroom with excellent complementary toiletries.

Comfortable bed, temperature controlled and exceptionally clean. I would recommend this hotel as an ideal place to stay if you want to be close to the airport but not so close that the noise is intrusive.

Show more
Robert , United Kingdom
Hotel Husa President Park
7.7 Very good
Based on 238 reviews

The hotel was pretty close to Gare du Nord brussels station. When you walk out of the main entrance of the subway, just turn right and walk for 5 minutes.

It was around 15 minutes walk towards the city center so we didn't have to take the bus during our stay there. Our rooms were upgraded to executive suite for an extra 10 euros/night which was really nice since the room we got was really really nice.However, We got bed bugs bite!!!!!! this is unacceptable especially for a 4 stars hotel. My cousin especially had a lot. Our friends who were staying in another room but on the same floor had the same experience with us the staff was very friendly, the hotel looked new, the room was fabulous, wifi was good but i hope they'll fix the bed bug situation!! we informed the staff of this but they just said they'll check it with the housekeeping

Show more
Jojobabe , Philippines
Radisson Blu Royal Hotel Brussels
8.3 Excellent
Based on 47 reviews

I walked in the room and found a blade on the floor which I almost stepped on. I put the blade in a trash bin and called the front desk whom did not even apologize and said they would come up for a room inspection.

They didn't contact me the whole stay and I had to ask for the progression myself while checking out. The answer i was given was "we could not find a blade on the floor, it is therefore not our responsibility"

Show more
Ariyatash , Thailand
Zoom Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 15 reviews

NH Brussels Louise
7.5 Very good
Based on 27 reviews

Eurostars Montgomery Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 39 reviews

The room was spacious. Bed and back linen of good quality and fresh. Overall room and bathroom are in need of renovation without being a turn off either.

Staff professional but no Dutch spoken although the hotel is located in Brussels. Breakfast has a wide variety of bread sorts, but variety of bread filling was limited during my stay, may be due to low oocupancy of hotel. If you want to be no far from the airport and still at easy reach of most of Brussels, location is ideal. Watch out for parking fee: 15 euro per day and parking on the street is paying and time-limited.

Show more
Kristien , Belgium
Novotel Brussels Centre Tour Noire Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 41 reviews

Stayed 1 night at Novotel Brussels City Center. Overall, everything is great and staff are friendly. It is in close proximity to the Grand Place, cathedrals and other main attractions, so we only had to walk around for sightseeing.

However, driving to the hotel ( and in Brussels city) could be a nightmare. Room is a decent size, not cramped but not only spacious either. Toilet is separated from shower and washing basin, which is seen in Novotel only (so far), but isn't an issue for us. Room amenities are adequate and there isn't anything to complain about. There is no view from our room (overlooking the wall of the building), and that's about the only cons of the room. Staff are helpful with information and friendly. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant and food was great. I had the duck breast with fettuccine and loved it very much. Service is excellent too. It has been a wonderful stay.

We booked this apartment due to its location & that it has secured parking. Was not sure what to expect due to several bad reviews that I have read.

1st impression when we walked into the apartment is that it is bright and airy. The high ceiling makes the place look much bigger. The apartment is simply and nicely done up. Kitchen area is very small and basic - a fridge, kettle, small cooker, utensils for 4 person & 2 pots. As we stayed only for 2 nights & was not planning on cooking, the basic kitchen was fine for us. The kettle is full of limescale, but I found out it us due to the hard water tap water. We decided to buy drinking water for making coffee & use the small pot to boil the water instead of the kettle. The staircase to the mezzanine bedroom is very steep, but my agile teenage daughter was very happy to use the mezzanine floor and she absolutely love it. The apartment does not have an aircon or any fan, so I believe it can get very warm during the hot summer days. Plus it's not possible to sleep with the window opened due to the noise filtering in from the street, which you can still hear even with the window closed though not as loud. Luckily when we were there, it was not too warm in the evening. All in all, I would say it was value for money due to its location. The main attractions are within walking distance, also many restaurants in the vicinity and mini supermarkets including Carrefour express.

Brussels is such a strange little city, but very loveable. It has a lot of history, and the architecture is amazing and tells a story all on its own.

Its quite multicultural in that there are many asian stores and restaurants around as well as many other European fare. The Christmas markets are AMAZING, and would highly recommend visiting while they're around. The beer is to die for and is a reason alone to visit the city, with literally thousands to choose from. You can't leave without trying the Trappers Beer brewed by Trappers Monks, and the Delerium should also be on your list, holding a world record of having the most beer (some 3,000 at last count). If you get a chance, take a walking tour - there is so much history and culture in the city and you will have a much deeper appreciation for Brussels and Belgium afterwards. Be sure to try the Belgian waffles and the Fries which are amazing and available almost on every street corner. I highly recommend going to the Georgette for fries which is down the alleyway near the Royal Galleries. The Brussels Museum in the Grand Plas is well worth a visit if you have time and are interested in the history and culture of the city. Overall a strange and obscure city with its own proud culture, and a place that you would love if you aren't afraid of strange and obscure. Not typical in the slightest.

More about Brussels

Brussels is a fascinating and gorgeous city that sits at a crossroad of cultures. It serves as the capital of Belgium and of Brussels Capital Region. It is also considered something of an unofficial capital for the European Union, hosting several related institutions. The region is served by Brussels Airport, and an efficient public transportation system makes getting from site to site easy.

There is no shortage of sights or activities when in Brussels. If there is one place to start, it would be the Grand Place and the 300-year old buildings that surround it. Most sites, especially in the old part of town, are within close proximity and easy to get to on foot. The statue of Manneken Pis is one such site and is an iconic fixture in the city. From Basilica Koekelberg - the fifth largest church in the world - to the Atomium, the simple sight of the splendid architecture here is enough to provide hours of entertainment. There are many museums to be explored as well, offering insight into history, culture, art, and science. Visits to a brewery, a horse-drawn carriage ride, and shopping for famous Belgian chocolates are but a few more of the wonders to be experienced in Brussels.

The room was spacious and got all you need. At first, there was only one small pillow for 2 of us. However, we found out the hotel offers a 'Choose your pillow' service, which let you choose the type of pillow you want. Nice touch! Our room rate included free-of-charge minibar service and we enjoy the snacks and drinks provided. Breakfast was excellent! They offered a wide range of food & drink and you can start your day with a good breakfast. Hotel location is just perfect! Taking you 5-min to walk from the Centraal Station, it takes the same time to reach the Grand Place. There are restaurant round the corner also. The only thing to improve is the wifi connection. Free access to wifi available at the lobby. But you have to login again every 30 minutes with different login names & password. Each set of login name & password is provided by a paper, which means you will waste 2 papers if you have to stay connected for an hour. Show more Chi , Hong Kong The Hotel Brussels 8.2 Excellent Based on 19 reviews Hotel Du Congres 7.8 Very good Based on 15 reviews Novotel Brussels Centre Midi Station Hotel 8.3 Excellent Based on 211 reviews Easy to locate - long Avenue Fonsny, barely 5 min walk away from the Bruxelles-Midi station. It is also only one station away the Grand Place. Trains to other cities/towns (Ghent, Brugges) easily available at Bruxelles-Midi. Also easy to obtain a SIM card for your phone there. Hotel is clean, modern, with a great view - if you like seeing trains trundle by, which I do. Internet is very reliable. It also has lockers to store your luggage if you arrive early. Hotel cafe is modest at best though, so I would recommend eating out. There is a supermarket on the way to the hotel. It also has a post office there, so you can send your postcards if you want. Great for business or younger travellers. The area or the hotel itself does not have many child-friendly activities so it is less suitable for young parents with young children. I ended up changing hotel because the area that my first hotel was in was undesirable (good hotel, was hassled by some of the locals because I was a female travelling alone. ) Show more Davis ,Australia It is small city and costs less than half day to walk around the center of the city. One day is enough for sightseeing. Li ,China Brussels has some culture but primarily a city surrounded by European politics, so it may not be the best place to experience authentic Belgian culture. That said, the city is still lovely and the food is good. It serves as the capital of Belgium and of Brussels Capital Region. It is also considered something of an unofficial capital for the European Union, hosting several related institutions. The region is served by Brussels Airport , and an efficient public transportation system makes getting from site to site easy. There is no shortage of sights or activities when in Brussels. If there is one place to start, it would be the Grand Place and the 300-year old buildings that surround it. Most sites, especially in the old part of town, are within close proximity and easy to get to on foot. The statue of Manneken Pis is one such site and is an iconic fixture in the city. From Basilica Koekelberg - the fifth largest church in the world - to the Atomium, the simple sight of the splendid architecture here is enough to provide hours of entertainment. There are many museums to be explored as well, offering insight into history, culture, art, and science. Visits to a brewery, a horse-drawn carriage ride, and shopping for famous Belgian chocolates are but a few more of the wonders to be experienced in Brussels.
